name: YouTube Bulk Subtitle Downloader

screenshots.caption: Download from single url, -- interactive no

short_description:
Note: This project is not being maintained anymore, in future it may not work. Use Google2SRT or youtube_dl instead.

ytsrt is a command line tool for Linux and Windows created in C to download bulk subtitles from YouTube. Not just bulk it can download single subtitle as well. It uses libcurl and ezxml libraries to download and parse pages. It can download subtitles from single URL or from playlist. Users also can provide text file that contains URLs to download subtitles for those listed videos. This tool can't download ASR and translated subtitles.

Make sure you read Readme.html (included in package) or wiki at https://sourceforge.net/p/ytsrt/wiki/Home/ before use.

for windows users I have created video. Please see it here http://youtu.be/2X9Sx6rRHLE before use if you are not confortable with commandline.

There is a great tool called Google2SRT, but as It is gui, I didn't find any easy way to download or convert multiple subtitles simultaneously. So I started this project.
summary: Download YouTube subtitles in batch mode.
